item.title: Study Week 5 — Exam Preparation
item.description:
📖 This week was fully dedicated to exam preparation.

🔁 Reviewed all programming topics: recursion, loops, working with strings and files. Practiced solving problems from previous years.

📐 For calculus, I worked through exercises on series and integrals. Improper integrals were especially challenging — had to revisit lecture notes.

🧮 For logic, I’m revising using my notes — made flashcards with formulas and typical problems.

🔜 Exams are just around the corner. One final week to wrap it all up!

item.title: Study Week 4 — Tests and Oral Exams
item.description:
📅 A very intense week: two tests — one in mathematical logic and another in calculus.

📌 The logic test involved constructing proofs using rules of logical inference. I made a mistake in one step — a valuable lesson for the future.

📈 In calculus, we were asked to prove Rolle’s Theorem and solve a few problems on extrema. I think I did fairly well.

🧠 Lots of practice — my brain is on fire, but I definitely feel the progress.

item.title: Study Week 1 — Programming and the First Test
item.description:
📌 The week began with intensive preparation for the programming test. During practice sessions, we solved problems on recursion and array manipulation. One particularly interesting task involved building Pascal’s Triangle using two-dimensional vectors.

✅ On Friday, I successfully passed my first programming test. It was a bit nerve-racking, but the tasks turned out to be familiar. I’m glad it went well!
